page.title: 01 FOLKESTONE - A COASTAL TOWN
page.content: Folkestone is a coastal town in Kent, the county in the south-eastern corner of England. It lies about 120 kms from London with a motorway and rail connection. The population is 42949 (1981 census) with many retired people and foreign students studying English. It is a busy cross-Channel port handling both freight and passenger traffic. Folkestone's population increases during the holiday season although many holiday makers use it only as a ferry port enabling them to visit Europe.
